==Gentoo==
Step 1: Install Layman
	* See here: http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/overlays/userguide.xml

Step 2: Add the Custom Overlay
	* Open /etc/layman/layman.cfg
	* Find the line that says "overlays  :
	  http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/overlays/layman-global.txt"
	* Add `http://belak.sbboard.com/gentoo/overlay.xml`
	* Sample code:
{{{
overlays  : http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/overlays/layman-global.txt
            http://belak.sbboard.com/gentoo/overlay.xml
}}}
	* Run the following commands as root (using either sudo or su)
{{{
layman -S
layman -a belak.gentoo
}}}

Step 3: Install slimrat
{{{
emerge slimrat
}}}

NOTE: Overlays will not update themselves. You must run layman -S,
along with emerge --sync to update all ebuilds, then run your update


==Other (manual installation)==
If slimrat is not in the repository of your distribution…

===Needed software:===
 * `wget`
 * `perl`
 * perl modules:
  * `Getopt::Long`
  * `LWP::UserAgent`
  * `Term::ANSIColor`
  * `WWW::Mechanize`
   * `HTTP::Response::Encoding` (newer versions of `WWW::Mechanize` depends on this)

For GUI (not needed for CLI):
 * `xterm`, `gnome-terminal`, `konsole` or something similar
 * `xclip` for inserting links from clipboard
 * perl modules:
  * `Gtk2::GladeXML`
  * `Gtk2::SimpleList`
  * `Spiffy`
 

===Installation:===
 * install perl modules:
  * *Debian/Ubuntu*:
{{{
aptitude install libwww-mechanize-perl
aptitude install libgtk2-gladexml-perl xclip libspiffy-perl # for GUI
}}}
  * *Fedora* (package names):
   * perl-WWW-Mechanize
   * perl-Gtk2-GladeXML (GUI)
   * xclip ? (GUI)
   * perl-Spiffy ? (GUI)
  * *FreeBSD*:
{{{
portinstall -Pp ftp/wget devel/p5-Getopt-Long devel/p5-Term-ANSIColor x11-toolkits/p5-Gtk2 x11-toolkits/p5-Gtk2-GladeXML x11-toolkits/p5-Gtk2-Ex-Simple-List www/p5-LWP-UserAgent-Determined www/p5-WWW-Mechanize
# + xclip, Spiffy
}}}
 * Download the archive and unpack it somewhere (svn code may not work)
 * Make symlinks in `$PATH`
{{{
ln -s /path/to/slimrat/slimrat /usr/local/bin/slimrat
ln -s /path/to/slimrat/slimrat-gui /usr/local/bin/slimrat-gui
}}}	
 * edit `config` file and select your terminal emulator
 * Run `slimrat --help` (CLI)
 * Run `slimrat-gui` (GUI)

=Windows=
(No gui)

 * Install [http://strawberryperl.com/ perl]
 * Download [http://www.christopherlewis.com/WGet/WGetFiles.htm wget]
 * Download & unpack slimrat archive
 * Unpack wget.zip to the slimrat folder
 * Edit the 'slimrat' perl script - replace 'wget' with 'wget.exe'
 * Install CPAN modules
{{{
perl -MCPAN -e "install Getopt::Long, LWP::UserAgent, Term::ANSIColor, WWW::Mechanize"
}}} 
 * Create 'slimrat.bat' file:
{{{
perl slimrat -l slimrat-download-list.txt
}}}
 * Create 'slimrat-download-list.txt' text file, paste links into this file and run slimrat.bat
